job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?
       We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
       About the opportunity:
          + Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
          + This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you
       You may contribute your expertise by
          + Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
          + Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
job_details.full_text:
Front-End Developer- AI Trainer (Dutch)

Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?
       We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
       About the opportunity:
          + Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
          + This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you
       You may contribute your expertise by
          + Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
          + Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models

profile_classification.rationale: The role focuses on providing human feedback to train AI models by crafting questions and evaluating code, rather than developing or engineering AI systems. While it involves AI models, the core tasks are more aligned with data annotation and evaluation than core ML/GenAI engineering.

job_tasks.justification: These phrases directly indicate involvement in the process of training AI models, which falls under the 'Modeling' category.

phrases: Engaging with these models as they learn to code
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes direct interaction with AI models during their learning/training phase, which is part of the modeling process.

phrases: Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
job_tasks.justification: These tasks involve generating data and providing feedback that is used to train and improve AI models, fitting within the broader scope of 'Modeling' as it relates to data preparation and model refinement.
The description asks for experienced software engineers and mentions coding expertise, suggesting a background in software development, though the primary role is not to build applications.

phrases: There is no requirement for previous AI experience.
soft_skills.justification: This indicates that the role is open to individuals without prior AI experience, suggesting a need for learning and adaptability to the AI domain.

phrases: Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems
soft_skills.justification: The mention of 'discrete, highly variable problems' implies a need for problem-solving skills to address diverse and potentially unstructured tasks.

phrases: hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you
soft_skills.justification: The freelance and flexible nature of the role suggests a need for self-direction, initiative, and ownership of one's work.
